descriptions.title: An Overview of Stateless Areas
descriptions.content:
Much of the world historically, prior to the rise to dominance of the modern nation scheme,  consisted or regions without any organized polity governing over communities. These are often termed "stateless areas", though they could also be referred to as settlement-based polity structures where each small-scale human community is an organizational unit onto its own without any broader affiliation.

The distinction between this and areas where there is a local form of polity that is organized around a single monastery or clan can be very difficult to discern. In addition, may one want to designate a large region as a "stateless area," but then designated smaller units within that large region as such forms of polities as agricultural estates, nomadic tribal areas, or monastic parishes.
